Job Description:
The Idaho Hispanic Foundation is a dynamic nonprofit organization dedicated to empowering and supporting minority entrepreneurs and businesses in the Idaho region.

Position Overview:

The Program Analyst will work closely with the Idaho Hispanic Foundation's leadership and staff to ensure that the MBDA grant is executed effectively and positively impacts the economic development of minority-owned businesses in Idaho. This role requires strong analytical, communication, and project management skills to fulfill critical responsibilities effectively.

Key Responsibilities:

Grant Management:

Act as the primary point of contact for all grant-related matters, ensuring compliance with MBDA grant requirements.
Develop a detailed understanding of the grant's terms, objectives, and deliverables.
Prepare and submit regular reports, documentation, and data MBDA requires to demonstrate progress and compliance.

Program Evaluation and Analysis:

Assess the effectiveness of program activities in achieving the grant's goals.
Analyze data and performance metrics to identify trends, successes, and areas for improvement.
Provide insights and recommendations to enhance the impact of the grant-funded initiatives.

Stakeholder Engagement:

Collaborate with the Idaho Hispanic Foundation team to ensure effective communication and coordination of grant-related activities.
Engage with grant stakeholders, including local businesses, community organizations, and government agencies, to promote awareness and participation in the program.

Resource Allocation:

Manage the allocation of grant funds to various projects, initiatives, and organizations as outlined in the grant agreement.
Monitor budgetary allocations and expenditures to ensure financial compliance.

Technical Assistance and Training:

Provide guidance and technical assistance to grant beneficiaries and minority-owned businesses seeking support under the grant.
Organize training sessions, workshops, and seminars to enhance the skills and capabilities of entrepreneurs within the Hispanic community.

Compliance and Reporting:

Ensure all grant activities adhere to legal, financial, and regulatory compliance standards.
Prepare and submit regular compliance reports to MBDA as the grant agreement requires.

Documentation and Record-Keeping:

Maintain thorough and accurate records of all program-related activities, expenditures, and outcomes.
Establish and manage an organized documentation system for easy reference and audit purposes.

Marketing and Outreach:

Promote the grant program through various marketing and outreach initiatives to reach a wider audience.
Develop and distribute promotional materials, host information sessions, and engage with local media to raise awareness about the program.

Performance Metrics:

Establish and track performance metrics to assess the program's success in supporting the growth and sustainability of Hispanic-owned businesses in Idaho.
Use data-driven insights to refine strategies and tactics for achieving grant objectives.

Grant Renewal and Expansion:

Assist in the preparation of grant renewal applications, if applicable.
Identify opportunities for grant expansion and explore additional funding sources to support the Idaho Hispanic Foundation's mission further.

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as business administration, public administration, economics, finance, social sciences, or a related discipline (Master's degree preferred).
Strong analytical abilities to interpret data, assess program effectiveness, and make data-driven decisions.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively convey information, write reports, and communicate with stakeholders.
Knowledge of project management principles and tools to plan, execute, and evaluate program initiatives.

Job Description:
Workforce Solutions (WS) is a new global business unit that brings together all commercial services teams across HP under one leader with a goal of providing a comprehensive portfolio of compelling services and solutions to our enterprise, mid-market, and even – in partnership with our strategic channel partners – to the SMB segment. Our goal is to enable CIOs to optimize the IT experience of their workforce while balancing other business pressures of affordability and risk. HP’s core strengths in personal systems and computing, printing and document workflows, and advanced collaboration solutions provide the foundation from which we will expand our services portfolio. Our passion for our customer and our employees will be our differentiation.

Fundamentally, you will assess the performance of future & existing offerings within the Workforce Solutions portfolio. This assessment will facilitate executive decision-making on resource allocation and prioritization – to maximize the return on investment and overall portfolio value.

In order to do this, you will perform deep analysis on the data. The data we have is vast – spanning multiple metric types, sources, and categories. Your job will be to dissect this data to find the nuggets of insight that help us optimize the portfolio offering and drive substantial growth for the business. You will need to have insatiable curiosity, and the drive to pose and test many different hypotheses against the data available.

You will use the insights you capture to make thoughtful and well-structured strategic recommendations to the senior leadership team within Workforce Solutions. Those recommendations will include refinements to optimize existing offerings, opportunities for growth that warrant investment, and areas to de-invest based on business performance. You will provide thought leadership to the senior leaders.

But recommendations without action do nothing. So you will also champion the changes needed within the service lines of the portfolio based on those recommendations. You will partner with the service line leads on synthesis of the insights, and answer questions needed in the execution of process improvements to existing products and service offerings. Similarly, you will also drive performance-centric improvements into the New Service Introduction (NSI) process used to launch products and services by closely partnering with the NSI team.

Driving our portfolio to be best-in-class will also require understanding of the industry. To that end, you will need to coordinate occasional external research to understand the performance attributes and characteristics of other key players in the technology services industry. This research will inform the recommendations you make to the Workforce Solutions leadership.

Finally, you will continually evolve the analysis process itself to be more automated over time. This automation will likely include (but not be limited to) heavier reliance on artificial intelligence. So, understanding the trends in this space and partnering with other groups within HP on the implementation of AI and other tools will be part of this role.

Partners with Data Science teams to evolve the automation of analysis using AI and other cutting- edge analytical tools, models, and methods for making key business decisions.

General Purpose

The City of Idaho Falls is accepting applications for a Business Intelligence Analyst I or II depending on years of experience and education.

This position is responsible for many complex technical duties related to the day-to-day operations of the city's ERP software and associated reporting. Installation and maintenance of City Information Technology systems and operations; including, software deployment, database maintenance, and reporting tools. This position may be required to take scheduled on-call for the city IT help desk rotating schedule.

Hiring Manager and the Human Resources Office will evaluate candidate experience/education to determine which level of pay candidate falls into:

Level I pay range = $31.89 - $44.56
Level II pay range = $39.02 - $54.52

Essential Functions

Provide an outstanding level of IT customer service to City Departments and consultants both with call-in, email, and on-site support.

Maintain and support city database operations including ERP software and reporting tools.

Develop and execute database queries and conduct analyses.

Evaluate and improve existing BI systems.

Create visualizations and reports for requested projects.

Gather feedback from end users about system performance and implement changes as necessary.

Collaborate with teams to integrate systems.

Coordinate developers to build and implement technology solutions.

Assists in maintaining City Server and related equipment and software.

Develop and update technical documentation.

Trains City users in PC hardware and software and related functions through business critical applications, networking, PowerPoint presentations and other related training activities.

May be required to provide after hours on-call support when needed for systems maintenance and/or system outages.

Work with web API's and services.

Performs other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications

1. Education and Experience:

Level I
A. Completion of two (2) years of technical college studies in computer science, computer programming, or related fields; AND B. Four (4) years of progressively responsible experience in database operations; OR C. An equivalent combination of education and experience.

Level II
A. Completion of a bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer programming, or related field. Completion of information technology professional certifications in the area of Microsoft, SQL, database management and networking can be credit towards the bachelor’s degree; AND B. Five (5) years of progressively responsible governmental experience in database operations and programming; OR C. An equivalent combination of education and experience.

2. Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Database querying and report writing. Networking (LAN/VLAN) system management concepts; information system management concepts; hardware configurations and capabilities; operating system fundamentals; data communication concepts; NetWare/Windows Servers systems, PC operating systems, applications and programs, networking documentation procedures; technical writing. Some knowledge of telecommunication equipment technology; system networking procedures and typical maintenance processes; various types of inter-related equipment, specifications and compatibilities; system programming requirements and software contingencies.

Ability to communicate effectively, verbally and in writing; make decisions where established procedures do not always apply; perform complex analytical functions; keep sensitive information confidential; operate personal computer and apply various program applications related to word processing, spread sheets and presentations; develop effective working governmental administrators, programmers, and system maintenance personnel; effectively manage workplace stress related to time deadlines, work pace demands, shifting priorities, and rapid changes within the information technologies industry; learn new systems as they are deployed.

Fingerprint and law enforcement background check will be required of final candidate.
Microsoft SQL DBA certification.
IBM Cognos report writing experience.
IBM iSeries knowledge and RPG programing is desirable.

As a BCBA working at The Children’s TLC, you will:

Conduct behavior assessments.
Write individualized treatment plans and goals.
Collect, interpret, and analyze data.
Create various behavior plans.
Provide quality, 1:1 play-based behavior intervention to children or adolescents using techniques from the field of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA).

Work closely with families, physicians, therapists, and other related professionals such as teachers to ensure the success of your clients.
